page.title: 04WINFRITH HEATH
page.content: Winfrith Heath is an area about 600 hectares in the North of our map.When the Atomic Energy Est.was built 80000 conifers were planted as a screen these have now grown into a natural habitat for wild life. There are three main types of heath_ 1)Wet Heath_where the plants Sundew and Pale Butterwort have evolved ways of trapping insects.Marsh Gentians also grow here. 2)Humid Heath_cross_leaved heath grows 3)Dry Heath_Bell Heather,ling and gorse grow here.The gorse is the habitat for various birds including the rare Dartford Warbler;stone chat;nightjar and red backed shrike. Two rare reptiles the sand lizard and smooth snake also live on the heath. Among the butterflies we've seen are the Grayling;Dark and Small Heath Fritillaries;Chalk Hill Blues.
